summaryText: Wow, what an incredible message about being bold as a lion in our Christian walk! Pastor Travis Hearn delivered a powerful sermon challenging believers to courageously use their God-given influence, affluence, and power to spread the Gospel. PT breaks down four key reasons we can be bold: our influence, our affluence, our power, and because we have the ultimate answer - Jesus Christ! He reminds us that every single person has a platform, whether it's social media, work, or personal relationships, and we're called to use that platform to share God's love. Pastor Travis hilariously yet powerfully illustrates how we're all 'rich' by global standards, challenging us to be generous and make eternal impact. The most striking point? We are the 'only Jesus some people will ever see' - what an incredible responsibility and opportunity! The sermon isn't just a motivational speech, it's a call to action, urging Christians to step out of lukewarm faith and become bold witnesses who share their personal testimonies and invite others to know Christ.
mainPoints: Use your influence to share the Gospel

versesMentioned.text: He proclaimed the kingdom of God and taught about the Lord Jesus Christ with all boldness and without hindrance.
If anyone is ashamed of me and my words, the Son of Man will be ashamed of that person when he comes in his glory and in the glory of the Father and the holy angels.
Jesus is described as both the Lion and the Lamb, who was slain and is worthy to open the scroll.

How, then, can they call on the one they have not believed in? And how can they believe in the one of whom they have not heard? And how can they hear without someone preaching to them? And how can anyone preach unless they are sent? As it is written: 'How beautiful are the feet of those who bring good news!'

You are the salt of the earth. But if the salt loses its saltiness, how can it be made salty again? It is no longer good for anything, except to be thrown out and trampled underfoot. You are the light of the world. A town built on a hill cannot be hidden. Neither do people light a lamp and put it under a bowl. Instead they put it on its stand, and it gives light to everyone in the house.

But godliness with contentment is great gain. For we brought nothing into the world, and we can take nothing out of it. But if we have food and clothing, we will be content with that. Those who want to get rich fall into temptation and a trap and into many foolish and harmful desires that plunge people into ruin and destruction. For the love of money is a root of all kinds of evil.
Again I tell you, it is easier for a camel to go through the eye of a needle than for someone who is rich to enter the kingdom of God.
I can do all this through him who gives me strength.
They triumphed over him by the blood of the Lamb and by the word of their testimony.
Therefore, since we have such a hope, we are very bold.

Then Jesus came to them and said, 'All authority in heaven and on earth has been given to me. Therefore go and make disciples of all nations, baptizing them in the name of the Father and of the Son and of the Holy Spirit, and teaching them to obey everything I have commanded you. And surely I am with you always, to the very end of the age.'
He said to them, 'Go into all the world and preach the gospel to all creation.'

Monday.scripture: Matthew 5:16: 'In the same way, let your light shine before others, that they may see your good deeds and glorify your Father in heaven.'
Monday.focus: Identifying your personal platform of influence
Monday.action: List three areas of your life where you have influence. Reflect on how you can intentionally share your faith in these spaces this week.
Monday.prayer: Lord, open my eyes to the platforms You've given me. Help me be bold and intentional about sharing Your love in every sphere of my life. Give me courage and wisdom. Amen.

Tuesday.scripture: 1 Peter 3:15: 'But in your hearts revere Christ as Lord. Always be prepared to give an answer to everyone who asks you to give the reason for the hope that you have. But do this with gentleness and respect.'
Tuesday.action: Write out a brief version of your faith story. Practice sharing it with a trusted friend or family member.
Tuesday.prayer: God, help me articulate the transformation You've done in my life. Give me clarity and confidence to share my story authentically. Amen.

Wednesday.scripture: Proverbs 11:25: 'A generous person will prosper; whoever refreshes others will themselves be refreshed.'
Wednesday.action: Look for an unexpected way to be financially generous today. This could be helping a friend, supporting a ministry, or giving to someone in need.
Wednesday.prayer: Father, help me hold my resources loosely. Show me how to be a conduit of Your blessing and generosity. Make me a cheerful giver. Amen.

Thursday.scripture: Romans 1:16: 'For I am not ashamed of the gospel, because it is the power of God that brings salvation to everyone who believes.'
Thursday.action: Invite someone to church or have a spiritual conversation with a friend or colleague. Challenge yourself to take one step outside your comfort zone.
Thursday.prayer: Lord, replace my fear with boldness. Help me see people the way You see them and be a vessel of Your love and truth. Amen.

Friday.scripture: Colossians 4:5-6: 'Be wise in the way you act toward outsiders; make the most of every opportunity. Let your conversation be always full of grace, seasoned with salt.'
Friday.action: Evaluate your recent conversations. Are they encouraging and life-giving? Practice speaking words of affirmation and hope.
Friday.prayer: Holy Spirit, guide my words today. Help me speak with wisdom, grace, and love. Make my conversations a reflection of Your heart. Amen.

Saturday.scripture: John 15:16: 'You did not choose me, but I chose you and appointed you so that you might go and bear fruit—fruit that will last.'
Saturday.action: Spend time in prayer and reflection. Ask God to clarify your unique role in advancing His kingdom.
Saturday.prayer: Lord, reveal my kingdom purpose. Show me how You want to use my life, talents, and influence for Your glory. Make me bold and faithful. Amen.
